page.title: 16RECREATION
page.content: An attractive feature of the village is the memorial gardens,which were layed out in 1948 on the centenary of Crittall's works and in memory of Francis Crittall and his wife. Old people love to walk in the park and it is delightful in spring with the trees in full blossom.Children enjoy having freedom to play games and to potter around the bridge and pond,although tree climbing is forbidden.Unhappily a minority of people dump rubbish in the pond and the toilets are closed due to vandalism and graffiti.Our school children try to look after our lovely park.Most houses have big gardens and allotments are popular.The hotel and Western Arms offer facilities for a night out.The school also arranges family social events,such as,fetes, dances and barbecues.
